recommendations.title: It's Time to Make Every Road a Toll Road
recommendations.excerpt: Few things exemplify the United States’ disconnect between personal freedom and collective responsibility like our automobile habit. Drivers travel at will, as long as they have money for gas and road snacks.

recommendations.title: The Gluten Project is a Search Engine For Finding GFCO-Certified Gluten-Free Products
recommendations.excerpt: A good friend of mine has Celiac disease, which means he can’t eat any gluten. While eating “gluten-free” has for some reason turned into the hip thing to do in recent years, for him it’s a serious health concern that makes going out to eat or grocery shopping a whole ordeal.

recommendations.title: Inside a 3-Year Russian Campaign to Influence U.S. Voters
recommendations.excerpt: WASHINGTON — In September, as the first detailed evidence surfaced of Russia’s hijacking of social media in the 2016 election, Irina V. Kaverzina, one of about 80 Russians working on the project in St. Petersburg, emailed a family member with some news.

recommendations.title: Why can’t Star Trek: Discovery commit to serialized storytelling?
recommendations.excerpt: Star Trek: Discovery has staked a lot on the idea that it was telling a different kind of Star Trek story — a tighter, more plotted-out version of Trek instead of the crisis-of-the-week style of earlier shows, which were designed to meet the needs of cable syndication.

recommendations.title: Kept out: How banks block people of color from homeownership
recommendations.excerpt: PHILADELPHIA (AP) — Fifty years after the federal Fair Housing Act banned racial discrimination in lending, African Americans and Latinos continue to be routinely denied conventional mortgage loans at rates far higher than their white counterparts.

recommendations.title: Europe’s future now rests on who owns the story of its past
recommendations.excerpt: Europe seems awash with historical hang-ups. And they are important ones. They may define the continent’s future as much as the outcome of Germany’s current political convulsions, or the state of Italy’s banks, or whether Brexit Britain manages to cobble a transition deal.

recommendations.title: Magic Leap promises live-streamed holograms within five years
recommendations.excerpt: Yesterday, Magic Leap CEO Rony Abovitz and NBA commissioner Adam Silver announced plans to eventually bring Turner-owned NBA content to Magic Leap’s elusive AR goggles, by casting virtual screens in front of a wearer’s face through the goggles.

recommendations.title: 10 great Finnish innovations
recommendations.excerpt: Finland’s “baby box” was introduced for poor mothers in 1938 and extended to all in 1949, when it held fabrics, a sewing kit, baby clothes, nappies and a mattress (the box itself doubled as a cot).

recommendations.title: Do Women’s Networking Events Move the Needle on Equality?
recommendations.excerpt: Recently, I was flying home from the Conference for Women, where I had been invited to speak. I was carefully holding a copy of the conference program on my lap — my mom likes to save them, and I wanted to be a good son and bring her back an unwrinkled copy.

recommendations.title: What Color Is a Tennis Ball?
recommendations.excerpt: It seemed like an easy question.  The query came from a Twitter poll I spotted on my news feed last week, from user @cgpgrey. “Please help resolve a marital dispute,” @cgpgrey wrote. “You would describe the color of a tennis ball as:” green, yellow, or other.

recommendations.title: Why Is It So Hard for Democracy to Deal With Inequality?
recommendations.excerpt: In theory, in a democracy, the majority should influence — some would even say determine — the distribution of income. In practice, this is not the case.

recommendations.title: From imitation to innovation: How China became a tech superpower
recommendations.excerpt: In late October 2017, when I went to visit Kai-Fu Lee, China’s premiere artificial intelligence (AI)-focused venture capitalist, I entered his office complex from the back side of the building.

recommendations.title: How Leaders Can Keep Their Cool in a Crisis
recommendations.excerpt: The word crisis suggests something that happens infrequently. But these days, crises have become a regular state of affairs. Brands that you’d think would be fairly immune to scandal have found themselves embroiled in controversy.

recommendations.title: Bill Gates warns Silicon Valley not to be the new Microsoft
recommendations.excerpt: Microsoft founder Bill Gates has a message for Silicon Valley: Don’t be Microsoft.  In the 1990s, the Seattle software giant became enemy number one for the US anti-trust regulators. Flexing its market muscle, the software giant elbowed out potential software and hardware competitors.

recommendations.title: Scant Evidence of Power Laws Found in Real-World Networks
recommendations.excerpt: Purely random networks do not obey power laws, so when the early proponents of the scale-free paradigm started seeing power laws in real-world networks in the late 1990s, they viewed them as evidence of a universal organizing principle underlying the formation of these diverse networks.

recommendations.title: Laser scanning reveals 'lost' ancient Mexican city 'had as many buildings as Manhattan'
recommendations.excerpt: Archaeology might evoke thoughts of intrepid explorers and painstaking digging, but in fact researchers say it is a high-tech laser mapping technique that is rewriting the textbooks at an unprecedented rate.

recommendations.title: Kendrick Lamar Does It Again on ‘Black Panther: The Album’
recommendations.excerpt: Kendrick Lamar kicks off the Black Panther soundtrack by rapping the word king 29 times in 50 seconds, in yet another of those dexterous verbal explosions that made him famous, made him beloved, made him royalty. “King of the shooters, looters, boosters, and ghettos poppin’,” he thunders.

recommendations.title: The Top 10 NFL Teams With Free-Agency Question Marks
recommendations.excerpt: The NFL free-agency bonanza is set to kick off on March 14, and the league-wide spending spree that comes with it has the potential to reshape teams and throw divisional power structures out of whack.

recommendations.title: The Full Text of Mueller's Indictment of 13 Russians
recommendations.excerpt: The special counsel indicted the Russian nationals and three Russian entities for allegedly interfering in the 2016 presidential election, the Department of Justice announced Friday.

recommendations.title: The Obamas’ Official Portraits Rise to the Occasion
recommendations.excerpt: On Abraham Lincoln’s 209th birthday, four American firsts have brought destiny, dignity, respect, and art together to remind us that this country embodies love, hope, and things bigger than the misrule and chaos that have come out from under rocks and have seemed to
